thread.title: Prairie Wind Ensemble opens season with concert at ICC on Oct. 11
thread.title_full: Prairie Wind Ensemble opens season with concert at ICC on Oct. 11

author: Staff
title: Prairie Wind Ensemble opens season with concert at ICC on Oct. 11
text: Prairie Wind Ensemble opens season with concert at ICC on Oct. 11 Comment Posted Oct. 3, 2015 at 8:38 PM Updated at 8:40 PM Posted Oct. 3, 2015 at 8:38 PM Updated at 8:40 PM EAST PEORIA — The Prairie Wind Ensemble will open its 38th season with a concert at 2:30 p.m. Oct. 11 at the Performing Arts Center at Illinois Central College. The ensemble will be under the direction of David Wetmore and Richard Cangro for this concert. The concert also will feature saxophone soloist Jodi Slagel performing “Tango Etudes” by Astor Piazzolla. Music for the afternoon will include: David Maslanka’s “Mother Earth,”“Colonial Song” by Granger, “Sketches on a Tudor Psalm” and “Florentiner March.” The second half will include John Mackey’s “Xerxes,”“Illyrian Dances,”“Crown Imperial March,” Grainger’s “Ye Banks and Braes O’Bonnie Doon” and “Kirkpatrick Fanfare.” Originally from Staten Island, N.Y., Cangro is now an Associate Professor of Music Education at Western Illinois University. Wetmore was Director of Bands at Macomb Sr. High School 1985-2014. By Staff
